description:
Do you enjoy writing test cases for your web application? If so then
this may not be the talk for you. I'm going to show you how to make a
single test suite perform triple testing duty, so you can get on with
writing the fun stuff.

First, I'll show you how to use WebTest to construct a simple functional
testsuite for your application. By running in-process against a WSGI
callable, the tests can be fast and light enough to form part of your
regularly-executed suite.

Second, we'll use WSGIProxy to turn this into a deployment/acceptance
test script that you can point at a real live server to verify its
behaviour. Run this after every deployment to make sure you haven't
broken something in the wild.

Finally, we'll connect the suite to FunkLoad and pummel the server with
a distributed barrage of tests, to see how it copes under pressure.
